text:
‘Doctor Who’: Peter Capaldi Backs Calls For A Female Time Lord Will the thirteenth Doctor be female? 01/02/2017 08:55   
It has been just over 24 hours since Peter Capaldi announced his decision to stop appearing in ‘Doctor Who’ , and the actor has now revealed who he would like to replace him. And yes, it’s a woman. 
Almost immediately after Peter revealed his plans to leave the Tardis behind , speculation over who would be the thirteenth doctor began, with a number of fans and a former star of the show stating that now is the time for a female Time Lord . Ian West/PA Archive Peter Capaldi 
Peter has now revealed that he agrees, and he even has one actress in mind. 
Veteran actress Frances would be familiar to many TV fans thanks to her role as Miss Ruth Jones, in ‘70s sitcom ‘Rising Damp’. Mike Marsland via Getty Images Frances de la Tour 
She also starred in some of the ‘Harry Potter’ films, ‘The History Boys’ and ‘Into The Woods’, and has trod the boards on the West End stage a number of times, winning a Tony and multiple Olivier award. 
On Tuesday (31 January), ex-’Doctor Who’ star Billie Piper declared   a female star take on the lead role , explaining: “I think it would be great [to have a female Doctor] given the spirit of the world at the moment. I think it would be timely”. 
And just in case Steven Moffat and co need a few names for the shortlist, we’ve done some brainstorming for them… 13 Female Stars Who Could Play The Lead In 'Doctor Who' 13 Female Stars Who Could Play The Lead In 'Doctor Who' 1 13 Helen Mirren Peter Capaldi is proof that an older star can be perfect in the show's lead role, and anything that means we get more Helen in our lives can only be a good thing.
